intro: Sonchus orixensis, commonly known as the Mexican sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in open fields, roadsides, and along riverbanks. It has alternate, rough-hairy leaves that are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating. The flowers are yellow and bloom in clusters, producing small seeds that are dispersed by wind.
